definitions.name: play_joke
definitions.description:
Tell a mortgage-related joke to the customer.
        
        Use this function when:
        - A customer asks for a joke
        - You want to lighten the mood
        - There's a natural pause in the conversation and the customer seems receptive
        
        Do not use jokes when discussing serious financial matters or when the customer is expressing concerns.

definitions.name: hangup_call
definitions.description:
Gracefully end the current Twilio call session with the customer.

Use this function in the following situations:
- The conversation has reached a natural or logical conclusion.
- The customer explicitly indicates they are done, such as by saying “bye,” “goodbye,” “that’s all,” “I’m finished,” “thank you,” “thanks, that’s all,” “I’m done,” or any other phrase that clearly signals the end of the conversation.
- The customer no longer needs further assistance, and all their questions or requests have been addressed.
- The customer expresses satisfaction or closes the conversation with phrases like “that’s it,” “no more questions,” “you’ve been very helpful,” “I have nothing else,” or similar.
- The call needs to be ended for compliance, security, or technical reasons (e.g., inactivity, customer request to hang up, or system policy).

Operational Instructions:
- Before ending the call, always include a `farewell_message` parameter with your goodbye message. Example: “Thank you for calling. Have a great day!”
- The system will play or send this farewell message and ensure the customer hears it before disconnecting.
- Do not hang up abruptly—ensure the farewell is sent and delivered (with a short pause if required).
- This function should be called promptly whenever the customer signals they wish to end the interaction, even if the request is implicit or phrased informally.

Sample Triggers:
- “I’d like to end the call now.”
- “Bye.”
- “Thank you, that’s all.”
- “I don’t need anything else.”
- “I’m done.”
- “Can you hang up now?”
- “No, I have no more questions.”
- [Any other phrase that means the customer is finished.]

Example:
farewell_message = "Thank you for calling. If you have any more questions, feel free to call us again. Goodbye!"

reason.description: Reason for ending the call (e.g., 'customer request', 'service complete')

call_sid.description: The Twilio Call SID to terminate

delay_seconds.description: Number of seconds to wait before hanging up (to allow for farewell message)

farewell_message.description: Optional farewell message to log before hanging up
